human.name: Human
human.description: youngest, most adaptable, and ambitious of the common races - innovators, achievers, and pioneers of the worlds - lasting institutions, variety in all things - everyone's second-best friends

halfWoodElf.name: Half Wood-Elf
halfWoodElf.description: of two worlds - diplomats or wanderers - keen senses and intuition - fleet feet - wood elves reclusive, distrusting of humans

halfOrc.name: Half-Orc
halfOrc.description: scarred and strong - the mark of gruumsh; powerful rage - tribes and slums - grudging acceptance

goldDwarf.name: Gold Dwarf
goldDwarf.description: short and stout - warriors, miners, and workers of stone and metal - long memory, long grudges - determined and loyal - gods and clan - slow to trust

yuanTiPureblood.name: Yuan-Ti Pureblood
yuanTiPureblood.description: unaware of ancestry - typical human, save with infrequent, inexplicable impulses toward 'other lives are cheap - survival first - depend on deceit' that you find yourself horrified by... but can't explain

bard.name: Bard
bard.description: music and magic - sheer versatility - learning from experience - discoveries beyond the horizon

collegeOfLore.name: College of Lore
collegeOfLore.description: know something about most things - pursuit of beauty and truth - cutting words - magical secrets - peerless skill

collegeOfSwords.name: College of Swords
collegeOfSwords.description: daring feats of weapon prowess - talent for performance - duelling or two-weapon fighting style - blade flourish - extra attack

collegeOfValor.name: College of Valor
collegeOfValor.description: keep alive the heroes of the past - inspire others to reach the same heights - combat inspiration - extra attack - battle magic

collegeOfWhispers.name: College of Whispers
collegeOfWhispers.description: uncover secrets and turn them against others - infiltrate and exploit courts or settings of power - psychic blades - words of terror - shadow lore

cleric.name: Cleric
cleric.description: power of the gods - devotion and intuition - healing, inspiring, smiting

helm.name: Helm (Protection)
helm.description: The god of vigilance and protection, He of the Unsleeping Eye is seen as the epitome of the guardian, the watcher, and the guard. Helm is venerated by those who need to remain watchful for enemies or danger. He is a favorite deity of people who make a living by protecting someone or something, such as bodyguards, members of the city watch, and the guards of a treasury vault.

tempus.name: Tempus (War)
tempus.description: Tempus is the god of war, concerned with brave conduct, using force of arms over talk, and encouraging bloodshed. The Lord of Battles' chaotic nature favors all sides equally: Tempus might be an army’s ally one day, and its enemy the next. While The Foehammer's favor is randomly distributed, over the centuries his priests have made an effort to enforce a common code of warfare — to make it a thing of rules, respect for reputations, and professional behavior. This code, Tempus’s Honor, has the purpose of making conflicts brief, decisive, and as safe as possible for those not directly involved.

waukeen.name: Waukeen (Knowledge)
waukeen.description: Our Lady of Gold is the goddess of wealth and trade, on both sides of the law. Her most ardent worshipers include shopkeepers, members of trading costers, caravan guides, peddlers, moneychangers, and smugglers. The Merchant's Friend is interested in anything that increases trade and the flow of money, whether new trade routes, new inventions, or the whim of changing fashion. Those who take Waukeen as a patron can be reliably thought of as greedy, but the Coinmaiden is said to frown upon misers and smile upon the industrious and profligate, and thus priests who bear her holy symbol find themselves welcome in many towns and cities.

fighter.name: Fighter
fighter.description: mastery of weapons and armor - combat style specialization - dangerous work is second nature

battleMaster.name: Battle Master
battleMaster.description: war as an academic field - combat superiority - maneuvers and techniques

eldritchKnight.name: Eldritch Knight
eldritchKnight.description: War magic - eldritch strike - arcane charge

monk.name: Monk
monk.description: harness the energy that flows in your body - training and asceticism - uncanny speed and strength

drunkenMaster.name: Way of the Drunken Master (City Brawler)
drunkenMaster.description: jerky, unpredictable movements - maddening, masterful foe - play the fool, bring gladness, demonstrate humility

kensei.name: Way of the Kensei (Descendent of the Bladelords)
kensei.description: the weapon becomes an extension of the body - a tool to express beauty and precision

wayOfMercy.name: Way of Mercy (Paths of Mussum and Nun)
wayOfMercy.description: wandering physicians to the poor and hurt - to the evil, a swift end as an act of kindness

paladin.name: Paladin
paladin.description: a commitment to justice itself - martial skills and magical power - front lines of the cosmic struggle against evil

crown.name: Oath of the Crown
crown.description: the ideals of civilization - serving society and the laws that hold it together - guardians on the walls against barbarism

devotion.name: Oath of Devotion
devotion.description: sworn to gods of law and good - loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order - knight in shining armor

redemption.name: Oath of Redemption
redemption.description: violence only as a last resort - hope of turning their foes to the light - no fools; know that undead, demons, devils, and other supernatural horrors must meet the wrath of the sword

ranger.name: Ranger
ranger.description: protect the borderlands - harness nature’s power - speed, stealth, and the hunt

gloomStalker.name: Gloom Stalker
gloomStalker.description: at home in the darkest places - ambush threats before they can reach the broader world

hunter.name: Hunter
hunter.description: bulwark of civilization - specialized tactics for fighting the terrors of the wilderness

monsterSlayer.name: Monster Slayer
monsterSlayer.description: hunt down creatures of the night and wielders of grim magic - trained in supernatural techniques

rogue.name: Rogue
rogue.description: get the upper hand in any situation - resourcefulness and versatility - cunning over brute strength

arcaneTrickster.name: Arcane Trickster
arcaneTrickster.description: stealth and agility - tricks of enchantment and illusion - pickpockets, burglars, and adventurers

inquisitive.name: Inquisitive
inquisitive.description: rooting out secrets and unraveling mysteries - read the words and deeds of other creatures - mastery of lore and keen deductions

soulknife.name: Soulknife
soulknife.description: infiltrate and strike with the mind - channel psionic power to do your work

thief.name: Thief
thief.description: the larcenous arts- improved agility and stealth - professional treasure seekers, explorers, and delvers

sorcerer.name: Sorcerer
sorcerer.description: inborn magical talent - body, mind, and spirit suffused with raw power

draconic.name: Draconic Bloodline (Blue or Gold)
draconic.description: draconic magic, or parentage, mingled with the blood of your ancestors

stormSorcery.name: Storm Sorcery
stormSorcery.description: the forces of elemental air permeate your being

warlock.name: Warlock
warlock.description: defined by a pact with an otherworldly being - seekers of the knowledge that lies hidden - magical effects both subtle and spectacular

celestial.name: The Celestial (Auppenser's Chamberlain)
celestial.description: patron is a powerful being of the Upper Planes - bring light to the dark places of the world

hexblade.name: The Hexblade (The Glory of Dhinnilith)
hexblade.description: patron is a mysterious entity that manifests in sentient magic weapons

deepLurker.name: The Lurker in the Deep (Naarkolyth's Ghost)
deepLurker.description: patron is something ancient, something that dwells deep below the waves

wizard.name: Wizard
wizard.description: supreme magic-users - scholars of the arcane - live and die by spells, everything else secondary - lure of ancient knowledge

abjuration.name: School of Abjuration
abjuration.description: magic that blocks, banishes, or protects - a proud and respected vocation

divination.name: School of Divination
divination.description: part the veils of space, time, and consciousness to see clearly - discernment, remote viewing, supernatural knowledge, and foresight

evocation.name: School of Evocation
evocation.description: create powerful elemental effects - freezing cold, searing flame, crackling lightning, melting acid - spectacular blasting power

transmutation.name: School of Transmutation
transmutation.description: modify energy and matter - a smith on reality’s forge - alter physical forms and mental qualities

alabasterOutcast.name: Alabaster Outcast
alabasterOutcast.description: You are a member of one of Arrabar's wealthier families... or rather, you used to be. A falling-out left you disowned and disinherited. You now hope find fortune and reknown enough to shame your former kinsfolk — goals which led you to the Harpers. Despite your exile, your family name still carries considerable weight in the region.

exDockTough.name: Ex-Dock Tough
exDockTough.description: Though you were raised as a member of one of Mimph's various criminal gangs, you never fit in with the rest of your settled, metropolitan brethren. The Harpers in particular recognized your wanderlust and potential as an agent. Over the years, you fell out of favor with the dockland gangs, and eventually left to pursue interests outside of simple banditry, though you still remember the lessons your criminal relations taught you.

exchangeAgent.name: Exchange Agent
exchangeAgent.description: Although you're a relative newcomer to Sespech, you're not some naive stranger. You've been sent by the Harper network of the Dales to learn more about the Vilhon Reach by experiencing the frontier firsthand. After arriving, you reported to Mimph and placed your expertise at Sendra's disposal.

monumentScholar.name: Monument Scholar
monumentScholar.description: As a child in Mimph, the city's ancient architecture inspired you with wonder. Your fascination with these relics has only grown in the years since: and, though you know little about the actual lore of the millennia-old monuments, you've studied these colossal works extensively, developing an in-depth knowledge of some of the city's most famous landmarks. Through these studies, you've encountered the research of Harrovyr/Martish several times... and they, apparently, have heard of you.

regionalWanderer.name: Regional Wanderer
regionalWanderer.description: You are a member of the Turami or Shaaran ethnicity; you left your homeland to learn more about the mysteries of the wider world. Your travels have recently brought you to the Mimph, and the attentions of a local scholar.

ruinRaider.name: Ruin Raider
ruinRaider.description: While the mercantile networks of the Vilhon Reach appeal to your keen eye for monetary gain, you know that the boldest route to true fortune lies in hunting down rare relics and selling them to the highest bidder. Working for the Harpers seemed like an obvious decision, paying for you to travel throughout the region in your search for wealth, so you signed up right away. You brought with you a sharp eye and keen ability to distinguish fakes from the genuine article.

harrovyr.name: Lady Sendra Harrovyr
harrovyr.description: human fighter, morningstar and quarterstaff - scholar of tactics, historian of battles - originally from Cormyr - clandestine Harper, reluctant schemer

martish.name: Sir Curonar Martish
martish.description: expatriate Turami noble - acclaimed scholar of the Vilhon Reach - socially refined, public face of Martish House - spouse of Sendra Harrovyr

tauno.name: Admiral Kalisa Tauno
tauno.description: Lord-Mayor of Mimph - first Sespech high official not from the Baron's old adventuring band - friendly but tired, constantly harried by matters of the governance - current focus is building fleet to counter Arrabar piracy

ferrentio.name: Watcher (Marasa) Ferrentio
ferrentio.description: high priestess at temple of Helm (largest in city) - young, powerful force within the entire church hierarchy - temple works with city guard to ensure no region is unpatrolled - also sponsors itinerant Helmite clerics and paladins across the Reach

nivlandil.name: Leïs Nívlandil
nivlandil.description: headmaster of Stone of the Seers (small/only school of magic in city) - focus on abjuration and divination magics - air of elitism ascribed to students and faculty - small size actually stems from reticence: knows how mistrusted wizards (and elves) are in the Reach, and wants to tread lightly

kalmeralm.name: Sabriyya Kalmeralm
kalmeralm.description: owner of the Bazaar of Sails - keeps the peace between squabbling traders, maintains fair prices, limits racketeering - quick wit, aristocratic bearing, fiery temper, and unforgiving memory - daughter of the first Prince of the Market (who disappeared ~30 years ago)

raakes.name: Ma'am Raakës
raakes.description: half-elven owner of the Coral Reef (largest festhall in town) - four-storey, flamboyant seaside manor-house - beneath passionate facade, a cold-eyed power-broker among the merchants and nobility... and, possibly, less-savory elements

droaeb.name: Jorsten Draeb
droaeb.description: dwarven Master of Games at the Serpent's Run (city hippodrome) - prefers to host decathlons, horse and dog races, displays of magic, circus performances, and (on rare occasions) mock-gladiatorial battles - despite frequent requests, never books what he classifies 'bloodsport'
